thread.title: Trump hails new 'MILITARY OPERATION' immigration policies to keep 'BAD DUDES' out of USA
thread.title_full: Trump hails new 'MILITARY OPERATION' immigration policies to keep 'BAD DUDES' out of USA

title: Trump hails new 'MILITARY OPERATION' immigration policies to keep 'BAD DUDES' out of USA
text:
AFP/Getty Images 1 of 18 US President Donald Trump speaks to the press in front of a Boeing 787-10 Dreamliner during its unveiling in North Charleston, South Carolina, on February 17, 2017 . 
But hours before Tillerson arrived, Mexico’s foreign minister Luis Videgaray was adamant that his country will not pay for a border wall. 
The foreign minister was also eager to confirm that Mexico will not accept Trump’s new deportation guidelines. Trump's proposed plans could force immigrants deported from the US back to the South American state instead of going back to their native countries. 
Videgaray said: “I want to make clear, in the most emphatic way, that the government of Mexico and the Mexican people do not have to accept measures that, in a unilateral way, one government wants to impose on another.” 
The two leaders did, manage to agree on their concerns regarding the human rights of Mexicans living in the US. AFP Rex Tillerson greets police officers as he departs from Mexico 
Trump’s bid to characterise his mission against anti-illegal immigrants as a “military operation” was met with controversy as John Kelly, the security of homeland security said no military force would be used to police immigration. 
Mr Kelly added: “We are not going out and doing mass deportations. We have laws that I must follow so we will be looking primarily at criminal offenders first. So there will be no mass roundups.” Related articles
